job.title: Site Reliability Engineer
job.description:
About IptiQ
iptiQ is a risk tech start-up within Swiss Re Group. Swiss Re is one of the world’s leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime.
iptiQ provides digital, bespoke and transparent L&H and P&C protection products in a B2B2C manner. Founded in 2014, we're transforming the way consumers buy insurance with a unique digital insurance engine which incorporates the latest technology with world-class underwriting capabilities. We build strong partnerships to sell insurance via trusted brands.
iptiQ offers a flexible working environment where curious and adaptable people thrive. Are you interested in joining us?
About The Role
iptiQ has openings for energetic expert Site Reliability Engineers to join us in our Boston, MA office.  We are looking for motivated individuals who have a passion to improve the performance and availability of our platform. Your skills are critical as we scale our business. Your understanding of distributed systems and how to tune and harden them are important to us and will make a big difference to our customers. Ultimately, your knowledge, best practices, and code will be part of systems within iptiQ's platform which is why we are searching for only the best and brightest software engineers to join our ranks.  If you think you fit the bill, then apply now!
Key Responsibilities
Site reliability engineer with experience in the specialty for 5+ years, proven track of implementing solutions/services for IT and support teams
Should have an engineering mindset, to be able to build the framework with the repeatable result, and have an understanding of how to convert “FIX” to automated recovery
Must have a minimum of 3-5 years of experience in developing solutions for complex custom applications in Java, Angular
An operational background or experience will help add value to the role as you bridge between the Dev team and the Ops team
Must demonstrate the ability to enhance application availability, scalability, reliability, and performance in a microservice architecture.
Must have experience in identifying areas for improvement including performance tuning, infra improvements, better monitoring and pro-active alerting, reducing the gap between incidents, triage, and their resolution.
Experience guiding development teams, in high availability, high performance, and cloud-native environment
Have a good understanding of containerization concepts Docker
Have a good understanding and building solutions on Linux OS
Demonstrate familiarity with Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment concepts along-with necessary tools like GIT, Maven, Gradle, Jenkins
Experience in working with Azure cloud services
Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical issues
Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to work effectively across various stakeholder in the organization
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to work under pressure and handle multiple priorities
About You
BS in Computer Science / Information Technology / related field or equivalent experience.
Experience with Azure cloud and multiple Azure services is required, including but not limited to AKS, Virtual Machines, Resource Manager, Azure DevOps, Container Registry.
Experience in Docker, Kubernetes, and Helm
Experience in building complex frameworks for infrastructure and application provisioning.
Strong Linux and Java troubleshooting skills
Java, Python, GO and related technologies, frameworks
Experience with Azure Monitoring or at least Prometheus, Grafana, New Relic
Working with distributed systems and with 24x7 Production Services/environments.
Cloud Architecture and Operations including migration, resilience, maintainability, and cost-efficiency
CI/CD and SCM tools such as GIT, Maven, Jenkins, Sonar, Artifactory, Ansible
